findings.risk: They take 0 responsibility if anything happens
Risk of impersonation without consent by using unauthorised voice recordings

Relies on users to only provide “authorized voices”, has no way/plan to enforce this. “To create a User Voice Model through our Services, you may be asked to upload audio recordings of your voice or the voice you are authorized to share with us as Input to our Services, and ElevenLabs is permitted to use those audio recordings of the voice you provide to us subject to subsection 4(d) below.”
Can be used for impersonation

Users, even once their accounts are deleted, could still have their data used to train its AI models. “You hereby grant to ElevenLabs a license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, publicly or otherwise perform and display, and use your Input to provide the Services (including the trust and safety features therein), to improve the Services, and to develop new services and products.”
Elevenlabs may collect certain information about you when you access or use our Services
You grant to ElevenLabs a license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, publicly or otherwise perform and display, and use your input
Defaults you as an “opt in” participant to using your content to train models, and you must opt out of this feature. “In addition, you may opt out of our use of your Content for training at any time”
They rely on third-party services to operate, and they have little control over these third parties. Any changes to the operation of these third parties may change this service as well
Will share data with any affiliates, vendors or service providers. (Section 4 of privacy policy).

Stores biometric data about users (voices), which is highly sensitive in the case of a data breach or leak “Depending on where you reside and how we use your Voice Data (as set out in this Policy), applicable law may define your Voice Data as biometric data.”.

Claims to produce “unique” audio, but openly admits the output won’t be unique across users. “due to the nature of machine learning, the Output generated by you using the Services may not be unique across users”
Voice providers have no rights to IP produced by their own voice “you retain all rights in and to your Output.” (here you are the script maker).
Can infringe copy right
Risk that output is not unique and similar across many users
Risk of widespread misinformation or defamation due to impersonation
Not all content is reviewed or monitored by ElevenLabs
WIll give advice on topics like law and medicine despite to not being trustworthy
Can be used for biasing democratic vote via voter suppression
Doesn’t claim any duty/obligation to monitor content (relies on user trust), doesn’t even review it.
Risk of unauthorized access due to impersonation via this service
ElevenLabs has no legal obligation to monitor their content, risk of extreme content

Doesn’t claim any duty/obligation to monitor content (relies on user trust), doesn’t even review it. “We do not undertake to review all Content, and we expressly disclaim any duty or obligation to undertake any monitoring or review of any Content.”
Can be used to amplify hate speech
It could promote/fascilitate self harm to you
If you are under 18 years of age (or the age of legal majority where you live), you may not use the Services
Can be used for sexually explict contnet involing children
Personal data collected so at risk of being breached
Input provided to the system is at risk of being adapted, published and distributed
Third party services may reduce reliability of the service
Can use your voice however they see fit, which is perpetual and irrevocable
You have zero legal protection for any beta component
